Title: Intermediate Software Engineer - Richmond, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
About MDA
For those who dream of advancing our space in the Universe and on Earth, we’ll take you there.
Serving the world from our Canadian home and our global offices, MDA is an international space mission partner and robotics & space operations, satellite systems and geointelligence pioneer with a 50-year story of firsts on and above the Earth. Today, we're leading the charge towards viable Moon colonies, enhanced Earth observation, communication in a hyper-connected world, and more.
We’re fueled by a pioneering spirit that carries us beyond. And together we enable highly skilled people to continually push boundaries and tackle big challenges requiring solutions that endure and inspire.
Are you ready to launch the next stage of your career in the new space economy? We would love to hear from you!
The Role
We’re on the hunt for a
Intermediate Software Engineer
on our Geointelligence team.
Our mission is to turn data into insight. From detecting changes in fragile ecosystems to monitoring northern ice floes and shipping routes, our near-real time data of Earth observation and the environment makes our Geointelligence team a leader in geospatial imagery, ground stations, enterprise geospatial systems and defence programs.
As our Software Development Engineer, you will contribute as part of a team to the design, implementation, maintenance, and testing of software solutions that are modular, extendable, testable, and efficient.
Responsibilities:
Creating engineering solutions that are technically competitive, cost-effective and have a direct impact on our customers
Working from requirements to develop or modify complex hardware/software systems
Planning work, providing effort estimates, driving your work to completion – on time & on budget
Designing, coding, testing, debugging and documenting high-quality software components
Working with the team to complete the integration, testing and deployment of the software components into the full system
Assisting in troubleshooting problems at both the software and the system level
Following established development processes and corporate technical and quality standards
Contribute to the continual improvement of our development processes.
Requirements:
A University Degree in computer science, software engineering, or a combination of related education and experience.
Proficient in at least one of Golang, Java, or C++.
An understanding of modern software architectures, object oriented design, and software design patterns.
Ability to quickly learn on the job and leverage your experiences and knowledge.
Excellent problem-solving and critical thinking skills.
Excellent verbal and written communication.
Team oriented approach.
Desirable:
Experience with Agile software development
Experience with test automation tools and libraries
Experience with Docker and service orchestration frameworks like Kubernetes and Rancher
Experience with Angular, React, or Vue frameworks
Experience with MATLAB and Simulink
Comments/Special Considerations:
Successful candidates must obtain and hold security clearance at the reliability status level, and pass security assessment for the Controlled Goods Program (CGP) and ITAR.
MDA provides competitive compensation and benefits packages for its employees at all locations. As a team member of MDA, you and your qualified dependents are eligible to participate in a benefit plan that ensures a comprehensive level of protection through competitive health care including; extended healthcare and flexible drug plans, dental and vision benefits, disability income protection, life insurance, group retirement savings plans; and an employee and family assistance program.
MDA is an equal opportunity employer prizing diversity and inclusion. We are committed to treating all employees and applicants for employment with respect and dignity. If you require assistance and/or reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please feel free to notify us.
With a priority on maintaining the safety of our employees, customers and communities, MDA has implemented a mandatory vaccination policy for employees and visitors. Please speak to a recruiter for more details.

Title: AWS Application Security Engineer - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
BS in Computer Science or related field, or equivalent work experience.
Minimum of 2 years of experience with any combination of the following: threat modeling experience, secure coding, identity management and authentication, software development, cryptography, system administration and network security.
Minimum of 2 years of experience with security engineering, system and network security, authentication and security protocols, cryptography, or application security.
Help us protect not only the Amazon Web Services (AWS) cloud computing environment but all of our customers as well! Since 2006, our great team at AWS has been enabling our customers to bring great ideas to life in ways that aren’t possible in traditional IT environments. With AWS you can flexibly harness compute, storage, security, and other services from across the globe as your business demands them.
AWS Security is on the cutting edge of many security issues for a wide variety of platforms and technologies including cloud services, Internet of things (IoT), identity and access management, mobile devices, virtualization and custom hardware, all operating at massive scale. Similarly, our highly collaborative team is committed to each team member’s growth as our business grows.
AWS Security is looking for an Application Security Engineer to help validate that our services, applications, and websites are designed and implemented to the highest security standards. You will be responsible for analyzing the security of applications and services, discovering and addressing security issues, building security automation, and quickly reacting to new threat scenarios. You will have the opportunity to learn from, and be mentored by, those who are building and securing our cutting-edge services.
You are expected to be strong in multiple domains and provide significant contributions to the AWS IT Security team and to multiple groups throughout Amazon. You are expected to develop elegant solutions to complex business problems and apply appropriate technologies while following security engineering best practices. You are also expected to mentor more junior engineers and be a security thought leader for the organization.
You will foster constructive dialogue and seek resolution when confronted with discordant views. Engineers in this role are expected to participate fully in the planning of the AWS IT Security team's work and constantly seek opportunities for process improvement. You should also have a deep understanding of at least one specialty for which they are a sought out resource (both within AWS Security and by groups throughout Amazon), while having an understanding of the application of information security in a broad range of technical areas.
You will need a combination of troubleshooting, technical, and communication skills, as well as the ability to handle a mix of disparate tasks which may include project and software development work. This role will provide career growth opportunities as you gain new security skills in the course of your duties.
Responsibilities:
Application security reviews
Mobile security reviews
Secure architecture design
Threat modeling
Projects and research work as needed
Security training and outreach to internal development teams
Security guidance documentation
Security tool development
Security metrics delivery and improvements
Assistance with recruiting activities and administrative work
Our team also puts a high value on work-life balance. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here, which is why we aren’t focused on how many hours you spend at work or online. Instead, we’re happy to offer a flexible schedule so you can have a more productive and well-balanced life—both in and outside of work.
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.
Meets/exceeds Amazon’s leadership principles requirements for this role
Meets/exceeds Amazon’s functional/technical depth and complexity for this role
Experience implementing security solutions at the business division level
An understanding of network and web related protocols (such as, TCP/IP, UDP, IPSEC, HTTP, HTTPS, routing protocols)
An understanding of web services
Experience with multiple programming languages (such as, Java, C++, Ruby, Python, Perl, etc.)
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Demonstrable teamwork skills and resourcefulness
Possess self-drive to keep moving things forward even in the face of ambiguity and imperfect knowledge (avoid “analysis paralysis”)
Strong sense of ownership, urgency, and drive
Sharp analytical abilities and proven design skills
Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status. If you would like to request an accommodation, please notify your Recruiter.
#AppSec

Title: Systems Engineer - Burlington, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Systems Engineering, design and manage complex engineering systems over their life cycles. Identify and find elegant solutions for real world problems and challenges. Be on the forefront of delivery and support for the latest cutting edge technologies and systems in the SDVN, ProAV, Mobile and Traditional Broadcast spaces.
Responsibilities:
System qualification testing
Assisting development teams with product integration
Develop and maintain custom scripts
Create technical documentation for system deployments
Control and System level regression testing
Supporting customer systems remotely
Supporting delivery resources remotely
Opportunity for field work
Qualifications:
Direct experience with Server Hardware, Linux OS and Network setup is an asset
Electrical, Electronic, or Computer Electronic Technician education required
Unparalleled desire to help the customer and deliver service excellence
Passion for technology and learning new software and hardware products
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Problem-solving ability and able to react to changing situations
Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment
Must be eligible for international travel and be able to work alone with little or no supervision
Location: Burlington, ON
About Us:
Evertz Microsystems (TSX:ET) is a leading global manufacturer of broadcast equipment and solutions that deliver content to television sets, on-demand services, WebTV, IPTV, and mobile devices (like phones and tablets). Evertz has expertise in delivering complete end-to-end broadcast solutions for all aspects of broadcast production including content creation, content distribution and content delivery. Considered as an innovator by their customers, Evertz delivers cutting edge solutions that are unmatched in the industry in both hardware and software. Evertz delivers products and solutions that can be found in major broadcast facilities on every continent. Evertz’ customer base also includes telcos, satellite, cable TV, and IPTV providers. With over 1700 employees, that include hardware and software engineers, Evertz is one of the leaders in the broadcast industry. Evertz has a global presence with offices located in: Canada, United States, United Kingdom, Germany, United Arab Emirates, India, Hong Kong, China, Singapore, and Australia. Evertz was named one of Canada’s 50 Best Managed Companies, which recognizes excellence in Canadian-owned and Canadian-managed companies. Canada’s 50 Best Managed Companies identifies Canadian corporate success through companies focused on their core vision, creating stakeholder value and excelling in the global economy.
Evertz makes certain there is an equal employment opportunity for all employees and applicants for employment, including persons with disabilities. In compliance with AODA, Evertz will strive to provide accommodation to persons with disabilities in the recruitment process upon request. If you are selected for an interview and you require accommodation due to a disability during the recruitment process, please notify Human Resources upon scheduling your interview.
Thank you for considering a career with Evertz

Title: Intermediate System Engineer - Burnaby, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
About NETINT Technologies Inc.
NETINT Technologies is a pioneer of computational storage and video processing SoC solutions for cloud and edge computing. Its Codensity portfolio enables enterprise, cloud data centers, and content providers to deploy high-performance applications that they can scale without limit while minimizing their data storage and video processing costs. NETINT, founded by an experienced team of storage SoC veterans, is a Canadian venture-funded startup with R&D facilities in Vancouver, Toronto, and Shanghai, China. For more information, visit www.netint.ca.
Job Scope
As a System Engineer, you are responsible for the functionality and quality of the ASIC design at the system level. You are detail oriented in designing and executing stress tests, and good at systematically identifying and reproducing hardware and firmware issues. You will be working closely with ASIC designer and embedded FW engineer to develop solutions and workarounds. Responsibilities for this position include designing/ implementing/ executing stress tests at subsystem and system levels, functional modules, and all data flows of Storage and Video SoCs.
Responsibilities
Hands on debug capability using lab equipment and debugger tools
Bring up of embedded CPU/GPU cores, subsystem blocks and system level integration on prototype boards
Develop embedded firmware for system level stress tests
Develop automation test platform and test scripts
Work with hardware and firmware teams on identifying and resolving issues, and come up with workaround solutions
Work on prototyping platform development and verification of current and future SoCs
Qualifications
MS or BS in Electrical/Computer Engineering or equivalent
Minimum 2 years of experiences in system validation or ASIC/FPGA IP/VIP integration and design
Ability to understand hardware technical reference manual
Experience with embedded FW in C/C++ and assembly
Experience with CPU architectures, high speed I/Os and on-chip interconnects
Knowledge of scripting languages such as Python, TCL, Perl
Strong ability to analyze complex HW issues and find resolutions
Highly Desirable Skills
Experience of working on video products is an asset
Experience in PCB design, layout, and board bring up is an asset
Knowledge of silicon testing/qualification procedure/methodology for production is an asset
We thank you for your interest, however, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
Acknowledgment and Agreement
NETINT Technologies Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and strives to ensure that its hiring process meets the needs of all persons with disabilities. As such, NETINT will provide reasonable accommodation for any applicant, as requested during the hiring process.

Title: Software Development Manager - Vancouver, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
Anyon Systems is a quantum computing company . The company's headquarter is in Montreal, QC and we have satellite locations in Toronto and Waterloo, ON as well as Vancouver, BC. We work at the cutting edge of technology to develop and commercialize superconducting quantum computers. We deliver near term superconducting quantum computing platforms including the quantum computing hardware as well as software stack to early adopters such as High Performance Computing (HPC) centers, government agencies and enterprise research labs.
Location and Hybrid Work Model:
This position is available in our offices in Montreal, Toronto, Waterloo and Vancouver. Our experience with working during COVID-19 pandemic has shown that besides the traditional in-office work model, a hybrid model can also be very effective and productive, allowing for better work-life balance while maintaining human contact with colleagues.
Your Role and Responsibilities:
You will be leading our Infrastructure Software Team, a team of engineers and scientists dedicated to the develop the software infrastructure that allows users to use our quantum computer.
Your primary focus is building a world-class team (hiring and coaching), and putting them in the best position to succeed. You must also efficiently coordinate across departments to accomplish collaborative goals.
Responsibilities
Hire an incredible team that lives our values and culture.
Improve the happiness and productivity of the team
Hold regular 1:1's with team members
Manage team projects
Work across sections within engineering
Improve the quality, security and performance of the product
Work on small code changes outside of the critical path
You will collaborate closely with other teams when required. If you are a self-starter, team player, have the hunger to venture into unknown areas, are results oriented and work cohesively within the team. Join us!
Qualifications:
3+ years managing software development and site reliability engineering teams
Strong technical background
Experience with high performance computing or cloud computing
Demonstrated teamwork in a peak performance organization
Experience running a consumer scale platform
Product company experience
Enterprise software company experience or startup experience
Computer science education or equivalent experience
Passionate about open source and developer tools
Passionate about quantum computing
Exquisite communication skills
Experience in managing a remote team
Experience with GitLab and CI/CD Tools
Skills:
Initiative, strong critical thinking and solution-oriented mindset;
Ability to adapt to fast-moving R&D environment;
Excellent communication skills and ability to work effectively with others.

Description:
Responsibilities
Develop and testing the UI based on NVIDIA Jetson
Develop comprehensive test plans related to hardware and software for high availability
Design/implementing device interfaces for reading data from raw sensors
Desired skills/experience

Title: Senior Firmware Engineer - Richmond, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
Shearwater Research is a privately held, profitable technology company which is the world leader in the field of technical diving computers and rebreather oxygen controllers. Based in Richmond, British Columbia, we have dealers in over 70 countries, and service centers in Canada, USA, UK, and New Zealand. We take pride in our corporate culture of high energy excellence, with self-managed professionals who thrive in delivering results in a tangible, visible manner. We are a fast growing company with a very bright future.
We provide a culture that embraces innovation, passion, and performance excellence. We offer professional growth opportunities and a dynamic, informal, and engaging workplace. Join our team and enjoy an inspiring environment, where challenging and interesting work is part of daily life. We invite you to check us out at www.shearwater.com
As a Senior Firmware Engineer you will develop highly-reliable code for advanced technical dive computers and rebreather control systems. Coding is primarily in C and encompasses the entire range of embedded development from peripheral drivers to user interfaces. Best practices will be employed and continually refined regarding architecture, maintainability, documentation, and testability. Being a mentor to other firmware engineers to encourage professional growth and the application of best practices will be an important aspect of this role. This position reports directly to the Director of Engineering.
Key Skills and Qualifications You Bring
8+ years experience developing high-reliability embedded systems
High competency in C for embedded systems
Understanding of the limitations of C in highly reliable systems
Knowledge of RTOS and embedded firmware architecture
Experience with ARM Cortex microcontrollers and writing drivers for MCU peripherals
Able to read schematics and PCB layouts and perform basic hardware debugging
Able to operate electronics test equipment such as multimeters, debuggers, oscilloscopes, and logic analyzers
Familiar with common engineering tools such as revision control, bug tracking, and project management systems
Key Competencies You Bring
An excellent record of individual technical achievement
An architectural thinker, able to design embedded systems for long-term success by drawing on previous experience and knowledge of best design practices for reliability, scalability, and security
An effective communicator, able to articulate complex technical specifications to senior customers and partner engineers, while also communicating successfully with less technical staff members
A team player with an affinity for inclusion and collaboration in a technically competent group
Strong technical problem solving and project management skills with a drive to get things done
Beneficial Experience
Scuba diving or interest in company sponsored scuba training
Scripting languages (e.g. Python)
Bluetooth communications
Prior experience in a consumer electronic products environment
Desire to contribute to organization beyond core requirements
Required Education
Bachelor’s Degree or higher in an Engineering and/or Computer Science discipline.
Benefits
These are some of the benefits Shearwater employees enjoy:
Group RSP with company matching contributions 100% up to an annual maximum of $2,500
Competitive vacation allowance that increases over time
Enhanced Health and Dental medical plan $3,500 for married/$1,750 for single (extremely flexible plan, no co-pay or monthly fee)
5 personal days per calendar year (paid out if not used)
Diving – open water, dry suit and advanced covered; possibly more as approved by manager
Free dive equipment rentals and air fills
Training available to all staff
First-come, first-served for vacation requests
Annual bonuses based on the annual financial performance of the company
$1000 employee referral bonus
To apply, send your cover letter and resume to resume@shearwater.com
Shearwater Research
, is a privately held technology ISO9001:2015 certified world leader in the field of dive computers for serious divers. Based in Richmond, British Columbia, we have dealers in over 70 countries, and service centres in Canada, USA, UK, and New Zealand.
Shearwater Research is an equal opportunity employer. If you are contacted regarding the position, please advise the member of our recruiting team of any accommodation measures you may require during our selection process. Information received relating to accommodation needs of applicants will be addressed confidentially.

Title: Sr. Infrastructure Windows Virtualization Engineer - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.
At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.
To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com
Job Description
What You’ll Be Doing
You’ll be joining the Infrastructure Engineering team within CIBC’s Infrastructure group. As a Senior Infrastructure Engineer, you’ll be responsible for the testing, maintenance and quality assurance of CIBC IT Infrastructure Windows Virtual technologies. Responsible for all Windows Servers which include many versions and Monitoring Tools. You will foster ideation and impact our digital and agile transformation by enhancing our clients’ banking experience.
How You’ll Succeed
Planning and Coordination:
Effectively interact with stakeholders, end users, business analysts, and technical resources to gather requirements and prepare design specifications as instructed by senior team members. Acts as Operations Coach and Mentor within scope of responsibility above with all Application Delivery teams and Technology and Operations teams. Monitor and Plan for Capacity within the virtualized infrastructure.
Strong Communication Skills:
You are a strong written/verbal communicator who is willing to speak up to ensure clear communication channels with team members and other teams. You are able to clearly communicate with different team members and teams while also being able to communicate to executive leadership when required. Able to support the operational teams in delivering a highly available infrastructure.
Technological Knowledge:
You are able to demonstrate a strong technical experience in Quality Assurance, IT Infrastructure and Mainframe. Utilizing your skillset in a leadership capacity to drive progress and provide resolution to any issues that may arise.
Who You Are
You can demonstrate experience
in Automation (SCCM), Windows Server and Virtualization. Monitoring (SCOM, SiteScope)
It is an asset if
you have experience with Ansible, Artifactory or Security best-practices. You also have experience working in an Agile environment or a CSM certification. Experience working with VMWare, vCentre, vRealize suite. Experience with x86 Enterprise Hardware (Dell, IBM HPE, Intel) and how it interacts with related SAN and Network technologies. Experience with VSAN and NSX is a bonus.
You have a degree/diploma in
Computer Science, and/or a related field.
You're driven by collective success.
You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to bring a shared vision to life.
You embrace and champion change.
You'll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best.
You
have a degree/diploma in
Computer Science, Programming, Computer Engineering or provide demonstrated experience and certification.
Values matter to you
. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.
What CIBC Offers
At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:
Thrive:
Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
Connect:
Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
Develop:
Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
Prosper
: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan
What you need to know
CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit
Job Location
Toronto-483 Bay St. 6th Floor
Employment Type
Regular
Weekly Hours
37.5
Primary Recruiter
Michael Soos

Title: Territory Manager II - Lachine, QC - Indeed.com
Description:
Deliver Business Value, Be A Future Shaper
As a Fortune 100 company and recognized as one of the ‘World’s Most Admired Companies’ for 13 years consecutively, Honeywell Productivity Solutions & Services (PSS) is a leading manufacturer of high-performance enterprise class data collection hardware including, rugged mobile computers, barcode printers, voice data devices and RFID readers. Honeywell has completed several strategic acquisitions totaling more than a $2B investment incorporating Intermec, Vocollect, Datamax-O’Neil, Enterprise Mobile, and more recently, Intelligrated. Through these acquisitions, Honeywell has created an enviable position with over 45 years of experience in the Auto-ID sector. We complement our innovative products with advanced software, service and professional solutions that enable customers to effectively manage data and assets. Our products increase productivity, improve operations, and enhance customer service for clients around the world and sold worldwide through a network of distributor and reseller partners.
Responsibilities:
Consult with assigned High Value Named Accounts & Target Prospects to identify, qualify & successfully coordinate delivery of cross functional and highly dynamic multi-lines of business projects for Productivity Product Solutions & Services
As the “Quarterback” you will lead the sales efforts and execution of our subject matter experts (SME’s), System Engineers and partners to obtain our growth objectives.
Prospect across the enterprises in your territory and North American Value-Added Resellers (VAR’s) to identify and engage with key stakeholders and gain customer meetings
Develop proposals and address the prospect’s business needs using an ROI-based total solution consultative selling methodology
Identify projects, provide accurate forecast details and pipeline weekly using SalesForce.com
Collaborate with technical and internal cross functional teams to achieve results, customer satisfaction and revenue
Develop, manage, and monitor customer relationships for the assigned accounts and prospects
Deliver presentations to prospects, customers, user groups, and industry professional organizations.
Manage expenses and costs appropriately
20% travel in Canada required with occasional overnight stays
Computer proficiency in MS PowerPoint, Excel, Outlook, Word, and SharePoint
You must have:
Post-secondary diploma
Minimum of 3 years technology territory sales account management experience
Bilingualism (French/English)
We value:
Bachelor’s Degree
AIDC industry experience or SaaS software salesSolid track record in meeting quotas
CRM experience ideally SalesForce.com
Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to present up to the Executive level
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, results-driven, and highly matrixed global environment
Strong prospecting and hunting skills
Strong problem-solving and negotiating skills
Knowledge of financial ROI
Additional Information

HRD139147

Sales

2100 52nd Avenue,Lachine,Quebec,H8T 2Y5,Canada

Title: Diesel Systems Engineering Specialist - Oshawa, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Job Description
As a Diesel Systems Engineer, the individual is responsible for the development of system-level requirements, translating fuel feature requirements into functional/physical system technical specifications and decomposing those requirements to sub-systems and then further to components.
The individual is expected to operate with a high level of independence and is typically responsible for implementing overall system strategy, discussing requirements with the Fuel Systems Engineering Technical Lead and Subsystem/Component Technical Specialists, helping with complex issues between multiple cross-functional teams, and counseling/advising management. The individual will receivegeneral direction from management but will exercise independent judgment.
Performs multiple tasks that require skills in time management. A wide degree of creativity and latitude is expected.
Interface with global teams across a wide variety of domains (electrical, hardware, controls, customer literature, Computer Aided Engineering (CAE), validation, safety engineering, body, and powertrain) to creatively and jointly execute the overall optimal solution for the vehicle and the customer. This also involves working closely with the Fuel System Leadership Team (including the Fuel System Engineering Technical Lead), the Fuel Subsystem Technical Specialist, and also Fuel Component Technical Specialists.
Interface between the software/calibration community which operate in the SAFe environment and the fuel hardware teams.
Collaborates with CAE engineers to assess system performance to requirements, and compares hardware performance
Iterate solutions that optimize system performance and component contributions.
Use internal software process/tools for management of specifications.
Create and manage Fuel System DFMEAs and ensure linkage via roll-down and roll-up processes to subsystem/component DFMEAs and PFMEAs.
Support test procedure and Interface Control Document (ICD) development.
Provide technical leadership and support for Fuel related Advanced Technology Work (ATW) projects and all phases of the vehicle development process
Define / perform competitive vehicle benchmarking in support of feature and system performance target setting
Identifies, tracks, and resolves engineering issues
Stays abreast of new technology and competitive products
Perform hands-on vehicle work to support system development
Lead system-level investigation across various functions/interfaces (powertrain, electrical, calibration, controls, fuel system hardware) to resolve complex issues, including recommending alterations to development and design to improve quality of systems and vehicle performance.
Support Fuel Subsystem technical Peer Reviews to ensure Best Practices, past lessons learned, and new System Engineering requirements are implemented on new/existing programs.
Travel as required (potential for occasional hot or cold weather test trips)
Required Skills / Experience / Education:
Bachelor of Science with a STEM focus
Understanding of engineering theory and principles of design
Oral and written communication skills
Demonstrated ability to work independently and with others
High level of analytical ability where problems are unusual or difficult
Experience withengineering operations, processes, and best practices
5+ years of post-graduation engineering experience required
4+ years of experience in fuel systems hardware, controls, and/or diagnostics development.
In-depth knowledge of fuel system hardware, controls, diagnostics, and failure modes.
Understand fuel system development, verification, validation and vehicle development processes.
Ability to legally operate a motor vehicle on a daily basis.
Ability to travel up to 10% (potential for hot or cold weather test trips if needed)
Preferred Skills / Qualifications / Education:
DFSSBlack BeltCertification
Experience with multiple cycles of Vehicle Development Process within area of responsibility.
Fuel System Design Release Engineer experience
SAFe Certified
About GM
Our vision is a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion and we embrace the responsibility to lead the change that will make our world better, safer and more equitable for all.
Why Join Us
We aspire to be the most inclusive company in the world. We believe we all must make a choice every day - individually and collectively - to drive meaningful change through our words, our deeds and our culture. Our Work Appropriately philosophy supports our foundation of inclusion and provides employees the flexibility to work where they can have the greatest impact on achieving our goals, dependent on role needs. Every day, we want every employee, no matter their background, ethnicity, preferences, or location, to feel they belong to one General Motors team.
Diversity Information
General Motors is committed to being a workplace that is not only free of discrimination, but one that genuinely fosters inclusion and belonging. We strongly believe that workforce diversity creates an environment in which our employees can thrive and develop better products for our customers. We understand and embrace the variety through which people gain experiences whether through professional, personal, educational, or volunteeropportunities.
We encourage interested candidates to review the key responsibilities and qualifications and apply for any positions that match your skills and capabilities.
Equal Employment Opportunity Statement

Title: SPÉCIALISTE – INTÉGRATION DE SOLUTIONS / Solution Integration Specialist - Boisbriand, QC - Indeed.com
(Contract) ASIC Design Verification (DV) Engineer - 100630 - Markham, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
What you do at AMD changes everything
At AMD, we push the boundaries of what is possible. We believe in changing the world for the better by driving innovation in high-performance computing, graphics, and visualization technologies – building blocks for gaming, immersive platforms, and the data center.
Developing great technology takes more than talent: it takes amazing people who understand collaboration, respect, and who will go the “extra mile” to achieve unthinkable results. It takes people who have the passion and desire to disrupt the status quo, push boundaries, deliver innovation, and change the world. If you have this type of passion, we invite you to take a look at the opportunities available to come join our team.
(Contract) ASIC Design Verification (DV) Engineer
The Role:
This is an 18-month contract position
We the Video HW IP/Solution Group at our AMD Markham site are looking for an experienced ASIC Design Verification (DV) Engineer to fill this Member of Technical Staff role.
You will join a vibrant established hardware (HW) IP team developing video encoder & video decoder HW IP (VCN)! This is a multifaceted role that extends beyond verification to helping optimize the HW solution.
The position requires working closely with the HW modelling teams, Firmware engineers, HW designers, HW block verification teams, and firmware developers to deliver test suites providing high functional coverage of the HW model & HW design.
We will require you to first acquire background knowledge of VCN IP HW core, HW C-model, test suite, and verification methodology. You will be part of the verification team, collaboratively understanding features & HW design details & defining required test scenarios for new HW features in a testplan. You will execute this testplan & own development & debug of a comprehensive test library and suite of functional tests to validate complete end-to-end video HW solution functionality of these HW features with a primary focus on video encoding. This will include validating that test scenarios run on a HW C-model function correctly and as intended. You will also debug these same end-to-end test scenarios on the HW design to ensure correct implementation.
You will help craft and refine a detailed end-to-end performance test suite to validate HW performance in real-world system use case configurations (both typical and stressful) and have deep involvement in helping tune the tests & HW to eliminate bottlenecks & ensure efficient performance.
Furthermore, you may assist in developing & improving HW C-model functionality to increase skills.
The Person:
An organized, enthusiastic self-motivated with a strong interest in verification methodologies.
Be a self-starter with a pro-active approach, taking ownership in driving tasks to completion
Good communication skills (verbal and written) with strong problem-solving, and attention to detail
Ability to work in a multi-discipline team and global setting as a solution enabler
Key Responsibilities:
Work collaboratively with the modelling team to understand new HW feature details and requirements & impact on the existing HW and translate these into comprehensive verification plans for each of these new HW features. Drive implementation & debug of the defined test scenarios on the model
Develop detailed functional verification test plans, and performance test plans for new Video IP features, by understanding the features & the interactions between the existing HW features, considering both real-world usage scenarios and high functional coverage
Develop test library software, test cases and execute hands-on testing, debug, and validation of all HW model functionality using these tests
Use or adapt test libraries, emulation models, and test cases from existing IP.
Work with ASIC design team (HW, FW and SW) to debug & tackle test failures at IP level
Develop, adapt, and verify IP performance tests to ensure real-world HW performance usecase targets are met
Automate and improve test suite verification efficiency and test suite coverage
Preferred Experience:
Strong understanding of hardware principles including Verilog RTL, UVM, test bench and HW verification
Strong C/C++ software development experience or equivalent application of object oriented programming concepts
Strong debugging skills, root cause analysis and attention to detail
Experience with simulation debug of HW using waveforms and other design verification tools.
A minimum 6+ years of hands-on industry design verification experience in HW ASIC product development
Strong understanding of video codecs such as H.264/AVC, H.265/HEVC, and AV1 is highly desirable
Prior knowledge in low-level firmware or IP testing are an excellent asset
Academic Credentials:
Minimum BSEE/CE, or equivalent degree in related engineering fields or computer science

Title: LEAD SOFTWARE ENGINEER - Markham, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Considering the current affairs, Allstate will be conducting virtual interviews and has made arrangements for new hires to work remotely till its deemed safe to return to office.
Through our Employee Value Proposition, Opportunity, Flexibility, Community, Diversity and Family, we have worked hard to develop and nurture a culture where employees feel valued, experience personal growth, have career options and truly enjoy the work they do.
Our team is growing and we are actively looking to hire The Lead Software Engineer act as an expert in software development best practices and promote these across their team, other Product Suite teams as well as the broader organization. They are responsible for the plan, design, and execution of all software development initiatives in the organization. They are responsible for providing technical guidance and mentorship to a team of Software Engineers and for all phases of the application development cycle beginning with requirement elicitation, through release and ongoing end-user support. The Lead Software Engineer is ultimately accountable for creating innovative, scalable, and tailored software solutions for Allstate Canada Group’s customers.
Role Designation:
Hybrid 1-2 days in Office
Benefits to joining Allstate
Complete Group Benefits Program customizable to your needs
Comprehensive Health and Wellness resources
Strong Brand Recognition (listed as best Employer with Kincentric since 2012).
Working within the community and giving back!
Opportunity for ongoing learning and career development.
We work a 37.5 hour work week
Accountabilities:
1. Scoping and coordination activities (15%)
Oversee requirements gathering and analysis to understand the domain of the software problem and/or functionality, the interfaces between hardware and software, and overall software characteristics.
Evaluate detailed business, functional, and high-level technical requirements (including recovery, security, and audit).
Translate software requirements into working and maintainable solutions within existing application frameworks.
Participate in detailed product or system change estimates.
Deliver incremental-working software by coordinating Scrum ceremonies to provide input, ensure their team has a clear understanding of agreed upon epics and user stories.
Identify improvement opportunities and implement actionable items for the next Sprint.
2. Design, Development/Coding & Testing (30%)
Oversee software development, change, testing and release management processes, assisting with the overall maturity of the Software Development Lifecycle.
Act as Agile lead by directing the efforts of development teams, both internal and external.
Oversee automated unit testing activities.
Collaborate closely with Quality Engineering, Technology Architecture, and other members of the development team to ensure the successful release of new products and applications as well as iterations of existing products.
Lead and organize testing reviews. Tracks and resolves complex defects and assists in planning efforts of complex functional tests in support of Quality Control (QC).
Design detailed technical components with high-level architecture.
Use future state architectures to develop technical components according to [end-user] design specifications.
Recognize, understands and applies use of design patterns for high complexity software applications.
Lead and participate in daily site, cross-site, and product team standups.
Lead and provide feedback in design reviews, sprint planning, sprint review and retrospectives.
Lead development of software solutions by better understanding the acceptance criteria of user stories based on information needs, studying system flow, data usage, and work processes.
Coordinate and participate in product scoping, discovery and framing by providing technical input and translating user features into system design.
Evaluate, maintain and improve the performance of existing software.
Ensure that design/code reviews are scheduled and executed; provide feedback and recommend solutions.
Ensure that design standards and documentation are followed and certify that code meets quality standards.
3. Release & Change Management, Collaboration and Product Support (10%)
Collaborate effectively by clearly communicating across technology and business teams.
Innovate on and implement continuous integration, continuous delivery, and continuous deployment (CICD) pipelines and practices.
Ensure change management procedures are followed
Participate in incident management as needed, root cause analysis and problem records resolution according to defined ACG Service Level Agreements (SLAs).
Interface with multiple Product suite and organizational teams responsible for strategic and critical pieces of architecture or that provide functions of key strategic value to the business.
Oversee the overall software delivery of multiple Product Suite teams.
4. Compliance and regulatory evidence support (5%)
Ensure own team and development team adhere to compliance requirements and regulations (SOX, PCI) where applicable.
Follow secure application development practices in adherence to industry and Allstate standards
5. Practice Maturation (40%)
Establish and build a leading Software Engineering community of practice.
Act as an authority in software best practices and be relied upon to propagate these in the broader organization, beyond their individual team.
Promote teams’ value proposition to wider department and organization.
Direct the team’s individual learning planning and actively contribute to own department’s thought leadership.
Determine and propose software development process improvements.
Promote and inculcate a knowledge-sharing mindset among their team of Software Engineers and proactively help the team to learn and grow.
Drive an innovation mindset amongst their team and keep abreast of technical and market trends impacting own discipline .
Help team members to develop their soft skills, technical leadership and conflict management skills.
Qualifications:
Over 6 years’ experience in technical lead roles in programming and software development.
Coaching and mentoring experience particularly directing professional and personal development of a team.
Expert in Computer Science fundamentals, Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and Agile methodology/principles. Extensive knowledge and experience with development tools such as IDEs and testing software.
Master in several programming languages, and demonstrated ability to quickly learn new frameworks and tools including but not limited to Java (Spring), .NET, Python, and JavaScript.
Extensive knowledge of Databases, including Database Development, Support and Querying (SQL)
Extensive knowledge of software engineering best practices.
Extensive experience across the software development spectrum including full stack development, front end and backend development design and implementation; database (relational, NoSQL, caching), messaging and big data development, implementation and optimization.
Advanced knowledge of common design patterns and their purpose; and when and how they are applied to commonly encountered design problems.
experience in writing technical and non-functional user stories and tasks.
Advanced Degree in Computer Science/ Computer Engineering or equivalent experience.
Full grasp of and adherence to policies, standards and processes that relate to the protection of ACG information and systems.
Application of secure application development (SSDLC) and OWASP vulnerabilities.

The company is proud to have been named a Best Employer in Canada for nine consecutive years and prioritizes supporting employees and fostering an inclusive, welcoming corporate culture. Allstate is committed to making a positive difference in the communities in which it operates through partnerships with charitable organizations, employee giving and volunteerism.
